item.title: AI4DB: Quickly responding mechanism of validating knobs efficacy for GaussDB.
item.description:
Supervisor: Hongzhi Wang, Professor in Faculty of Computing, HIT Exploiting meta-learning mechanism to enhance model generalization with dynamically changing workload of database, with the aim of decreasing model retraining cost and improving overall knobs evaluation performance.

Specifically, we mainly focus on utilizing gradient-based meta-learning on dataset knobs importance ranking & auto-tuning. Through considering each workload performance tests as a few-data task, we propose a meta-learning knobs importance ranking algorithm aimed at reducing dataset enormous knobs under the constraint of only few accessible attached configuration & performance samples each workload. We also design a differential tree model to leverage meta-learning paradigm for dataset performance evaluation & knobs tuning.

item.title: Kaggle: BirdCLEF 2022 Identify bird calls in soundscapes.
item.description:
Role: Leader of the team.
Designed two phases (detect & classify) to identify birds species from sound segment; Applied Audio Spectrogram Transformer (AST), Vision Transformer (ViT), AlexNet, CNN-RNN network as backbone to both detect whether bird sound exists in segment and which kinds they are.

item.title: TIANCHI: 2021 Alibaba Cloud Infrastructure Supply Chain Competition.
item.description:
Role: Leader of the team.
Propose a two components (prediction & decision) solution to help Alibaba Cloud (cloud host provider) maintain best-profits supply chain; Utilized LSTM, ARIMA, DeepAR time-sequential models to predict future demands; Designed dynamic safety stock policy to support decision.

item.title: Course Project: Machine Learning during Visiting-Exchange in Johns Hopkins University.
item.description: During course experiments training, we reproduced classical machine learning algorithm: Logistic Regression, Decision Tree(ID3), KNN, GMM, K-means, MLP, SVM and etc., and validated their efficacy on public benchmarks.
